intro: Knautia bohemica, commonly known as Bohemian knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of pink to purple, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and aromatic. Knautia bohemica is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and its ability to attract pollinators.
